fields.Name of Conference: 2004 International Conference on Imaging Science, Systems, and Technology (CISST'04)
fields.Description/Abstract:
The microscopic details of printing often are unnoticed by humans, but can make differences that affect machine
recogniton of printed text. Models of the defects introduced into images by printing can be used to improve machine
recognition. A probabilistic model used to generate images showing toner placement bears similarities to actual
printed images. An equation derived for the average coverage of paper by toner particles having probabilistic placement
is developed using geometric probability. Simulations show that averages of images of ‘printed images’ do have
the same average coverage as the derived average coverage equations.
